comment.author: 12220922@N05
comment._content: The presence of tea cosies and cups on the table, and the clock reading 8.20, would indicate that this is breakfast time rather than evening, I imagine. An air of elegance and tranquillity here - rather nice.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: Absolutely, Peter, and you'll be known to us as "Eagle Eye" from now on... (clock)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 30484128@N03
comment._content: Very nice interior photo. I assume those are gas ceiling lights.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: Would imagine so Jim, but there may be a 1920s lighting specialist who knows otherwise...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 38020241@N07
comment._content: Cada una de estas fotos, muestra un pasado comun, una realidad de un mundo que formo parte de cada uno de los que heredaron habitos y costumbres  de quienes les precedieron...Hermosa fotografia!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 30484128@N03
comment._content:
".Hermosa fotografia!"

Very true, a superb collection.

comment.author: 47044499@N03
comment._content: In my distant memory, I remember going once to Tramore, but don't remember anything else. It sounded such a mysterious place - I must have been only nine years old or thereabouts.

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content: I look at these lovely old photos of guest areas in hotels and wonder if they were really as described in George Orwell's book 'Down and out in Paris and London'! Stuart.
